title: Grades 6-8: Level I, Novice Mid to Novice High Proficiency
subject: Languages Other Than English (2014-)

document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Languages Other Than English

F14D918A17D74057BBC0110B1E432308.description: read prose or poetry aloud with attention to features such as metrical structure, meaningful phrase grouping, and appropriate voice inflection.

625456988C1447738936F6C8FE4B0134.description: cite the justification for an opinion or an argument orally or in writing utilizing textual evidence; and

7847C99DB3364D398D0F31D223D63333.description: Presentational communication: speaking and writing. The student presents information orally or in writing using a mixture of phrases and sentences with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

E9BB6E7DED1C4D9E9399FFD7B1A056A0.description: compare and contrast cultural practices and perspectives from authentic print, digital, audio, or audiovisual materials.

9F9EEE5358844D00AAD54FBA9E8FF742.description: infer meaning of unfamiliar words or phrases in texts, audio, or audiovisual materials; and

AC86CF7C7B714C97BE7C0FEA9E991A6C.description: analyze authentic literature in depth with respect to topics such as elements of genre, literary devices, audience, or metrics;

1CFA9317CB724B4DA23DD17B7F10D63A.description: paraphrase and analyze the main idea, theme, and supporting details from fiction or nonfiction texts, prepared or unprepared, or from audio or audiovisual materials;

F8217E3FB6CE4BFFAEB6F2D60B698A03.description: analyze culturally authentic print, digital, audio, or audiovisual materials in a variety of contexts;

EF509159F8F84B1F891339994E94C76D.description: Interpretive communication: reading and listening. The student comprehends connected statements from culturally authentic print, digital, audio, or audiovisual materials as appropriate within contextualized situations and sources. The student uses the interpretive mode in communication with appropriate and applicable grammatical structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

3D375F66BC184E3BB518B1EB0BBF145C.description: ask and tell others what they need to, should, and must do in spoken or written conversation using constructions such as the imperative mood, impersonal verbs, or the subjunctive mood.

31ABB92472464E689515DD7925AC5A7C.description: express and exchange personal opinions or preferences, in spoken or written conversation, using constructions such as impersonal verbs; and

01EBB7B892CD41C2AF78CC90269DF0DC.description: ask and respond to questions with simple elaboration in spoken or written conversation;

736B2D7081344B079B2CEE8AAB3F929E.description: Interpersonal communication: speaking and writing. The student negotiates meaning through the spoken and written exchange of information in a variety of contexts. The student uses a mixture of words, phrases, and simple sentences with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

7751B6B4EA4B40D9A630B7AC6E7CCEC8.description: Classical Languages, Level IV, Novice Mid to Advanced Mid Proficiency
